pullRequest.body:
A simplicial object `X` is *n-coskeletal* if the identity natural transformation `X` is a right extension of its
restriction along `(Truncated.inclusion (n := n)).op` recorded by `rightExtensionInclusion X n`. 

Co-Authored-By: [Mario Carneiro](https://github.com/digama0) and [Joël Riou](https://github.com/joelriou) 

---

This implements a suggestion made in #19057.


[![Open in Gitpod](https://gitpod.io/button/open-in-gitpod.svg)](https://gitpod.io/from-referrer/)

### PR summary [303c5be7af](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/pull/19492/commits/303c5be7af3da459286f30cc2150ab0d4c3501b5)

#### Import changes for modified files

No significant changes to the import graph


<details><summary>Import changes for all files</summary>

|Files|Import difference|
|-|-|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialObject`|-812|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialObject.Basic`|812|
| `Mathlib.AlgebraicTopology.SimplicialObject.Coskeletal` (new file)|813|

</details>

---

<details><summary>

#### Declarations diff

</summary>

`+ IsCoskeletal`
`+ IsCoskeletal.isIso_rightExtensionCosk_hom_of_isCoskeletal`
`+ IsCoskeletal.isRightKanExtension`
`+ IsCoskeletal.isUniversalOfIsRightKanExtension`
`+ IsCoskeletal.rightExtensionCosk.homIso`
`+ Truncated.isRightKanExtensionCosk`
`+ Truncated.rightExtensionCosk.hom`
`+ instance (n : ℕ) : (inclusion n : Truncated n ⥤ _).Faithful := FullSubcategory.faithful _`
`+ instance (n : ℕ) : (inclusion n : Truncated n ⥤ _).Full := FullSubcategory.full _`
`+ isoCoskOfIsCoskeletal`
`+ rightExtensionInclusion`
`- instance (n : ℕ) : (inclusion : Truncated n ⥤ _).Faithful := FullSubcategory.faithful _`
`- instance (n : ℕ) : (inclusion : Truncated n ⥤ _).Full := FullSubcategory.full _`
<details>
  <summary>You can run this locally as follows</summary>


```bash
## summary with just the declaration names:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh <optional_commit>

## more verbose report:
./scripts/declarations_diff.sh long <optional_commit>
```
</details>

The doc-module for `script/declarations_diff.sh` contains some details about this script.

</details>

---

<details><summary>No changes to technical debt.</summary>

You can run this locally as
```
./scripts/technical-debt-metrics.sh pr_summary
```
* The `relative` value is the weighted *sum* of the differences with weight given by the *inverse* of the current value of the statistic.
* The `absolute` value is the `relative` value divided by the total sum of the inverses of the current values (i.e. the weighted *average* of the differences).
</details>
Given how often you need to use a named argument to specify the `n` argument of `Truncated.inclusion`, perhaps it should be made explicit.
Done.
Done.

```suggestion
/-- If `X` is `n`-coskeletal, then `rightExtensionInclusion X n` is a terminal object in the category
```
Is this doc-string mistakenly copy-pasted from below?
Fixed.

```suggestion
of the `n`-truncation of `X` defined by the counit of `coskAdj n`. -/
```
I'm a bit confused by how the naming conventions are being used here. I think usually this first instance would be called `isRightKanExtensionCosk`? But I see the tension with putting `cosk` first.
Similarly for `isIsoHom`?
I've tried to do better. Let me know what you think.

```suggestion
The simplicial object `X` is *n-coskeletal* if `rightExtensionInclusion X n` is a right Kan
```
I would prefer a name like `isoCoskOfIsCoskeletal`.
No problem. I'll change it back. I was trying for greater uniformity but really have no idea what I'm doing..

When we introduce a typeclass (here `IsCoskeletal`) for certain objects (here `SimplicialObject`), it is often convenient to put some definitions or lemmas in the `SimplicialObject` namespace rather than `IsCoskeletal`. One reason is that we can use dot notation, e.g. `X.isoCoskOfIsCoskeletal n`.

```suggestion
instance IsCoskeletal.coskRightExtension.isIso_hom : IsIso (rightExtensionCosk.hom X n) :=
```
(`IsIso` is a Prop, so that this instance is like a lemma, not a def; then we have to use `_` as a separator.)

The name should rather contain `rightExtensionCosk` rather than `coskRightExtension`. Then, better names would be `IsCoskeletal.isIso_rightExtensionCosk_hom` (or `isIso_rightExtensionCosk_hom_of_isCoskeletal`).

As this instance name `Functor.instIsRightKanExtensionObjRanAppRanCounit` was autogenerated by Lean, it would be better to use a syntax like
```lean
  change IsRightKanExtension ...
  infer_instance
```
where in the `change` line, you would put the exact pattern which matches `Functor.instIsRightKanExtensionObjRanAppRanCounit`.
Thanks for the suggestion. I haven't yet mastered the change tactic so it's helpful to get pointers like this.
Though actually here the "change" wasn't needed!

A few of the definitions before this one are unnecessary, a better approach would be:
```lean
-- this instance should be in `SimplicialObject.Basic`
instance : ((cosk n).obj X).IsRightKanExtension ((coskAdj n).counit.app _) := by
  dsimp [cosk, coskAdj]
  rw [ranAdjunction_counit]
  infer_instance

/-- The isomorphism `X ≅ (cosk n).obj X` that exists when `X` is `n`-coskeletal and the
`n`-coskeleton functor exists.-/
noncomputable def isoCoskOfIsCoskeletal : X ≅ (cosk n).obj X :=
  Functor.rightKanExtensionUnique _ (𝟙 _) _ ((coskAdj n).counit.app _)

@[simp]
lemma isoCoskOfIsCoskeletal_hom :
    (X.isoCoskOfIsCoskeletal n).hom = (coskAdj n).unit.app X := by
  sorry -- use `hom_ext_of_isRightKanExtension`?
```

Then, using `isRightKanExtension_iff_isIso`, it seems to me it should be easy to show the iff lemma that `X.IsCoskeletal n` iff `IsIso ((coskAdj n).unit.app X)`. It would be nice to add this to this PR.

By making this an instance, it will usable by the right Kan extension API:
```suggestion
instance IsCoskeletal.isRightKanExtension :
```

pullRequest.title: feat(CategoryTheory): coskeletal simplicial objects
